quotes: Swiss Federal Councillor from 2006 to 2018
Member of the Swiss Federal Council from 2006 to 2018
In office 1 January 2017 – 31 December 2017
In office 1 January 2010 – 31 December 2010
In office 1 January 2016 – 31 December 2016
In office 1 January 2009 – 31 December 2009
In office 1 November 2010 – 31 December 2018
In office 1 August 2006 – 31 October 2010
As of 19 December 2019 she is a member of the board of the Kofi Annan Foundation and Stadler Rail
Leuthard was a member of the Swiss National Council from 1999 to 2006 for the canton of Aargau.
She presided over the Christian Democratic People's Party from 2004 to 2006.
Leuthard was elected as his successor on 14 June 2006.
From 1 August 2006 until 31 October 2010, she was head of the Federal Department of Economic Affairs.
On 1 November 2010 she became head of the Federal Department of Environment, Transport, Energy and Communications.
For the calendar year 2009, Leuthard was elected Vice President of the Swiss Confederation.
For the calendar year 2010.
She was elected President of the Confederation for 2010 and 2017.
Ruth Dreifuss (1999)
Micheline Calmy-Rey (2007)
She was succeeded by Calmy-Rey in 2011.
by-election of two new Federal Councillors in 2010
In her capacity as minister, she was appointed by United Nations Secretary General António Guterres in 2018 to the High-level Panel on Digital Cooperation, co-chaired by Melinda Gates and Jack Ma.
In July 2022, Swiss media reported that Doris Leuthard was the victim of aggression by her husband in their vacation home in Ticino with a knife.

roles.title: head of state

quotes: However, in most cases, Leuthard was merely primus inter pares, with no power above and beyond her six colleagues.

Leuthard was a member of the Swiss National Council from 1999 to 2006 for the canton of Aargau.
In her capacity as minister, she was appointed by United Nations Secretary General António Guterres in 2018 to the High-level Panel on Digital Cooperation, co-chaired by Melinda Gates and Jack Ma.
In July 2022, Swiss media reported that Doris Leuthard was the victim of aggression by her husband in their vacation home in Ticino with a knife.
